To my L Treasurer for John Throckmort
o
Au
g
23. 90
fol. 265r
Belgia:1590. Au
g
Belgia 1590 23 Au
g
to my L. Trea
s
May it please yo
r
good L. there is lately
deceased, at
Disbourgh
in
Gelderland
Captain
Smith
, whose lieutenant
John Throckmorton
,
hath bin ever esteemed an honest, and a va-
liant gentleman: wherof his service made
proofe, in
e last encounter w
t
e Enemie, at
e victualling of
Berke
. I thinke
S
r
Francis
Vere
, who hath alwaies commended him, for
his valew and conduct, will affourde him
that testimonie, that is dewe unto him. He
was first lieutenant to
Captain Hart
, and
after his decease, became suto
r
for his captains
rowme, whiche was then conferred
up
o
cap
t
H
u
ninges
, and after againe
uppon cap
t
Smith, who being departed, if nowe
e third
time he should not be respected, it would
muche discourage both him and others, that
serve as Lieutenants: whiche yo
r
L. I trust,
will take in good part, that I signifie thus
boldly.
And so I take my humble leave.
From
e
Hage
. Au
g
23 A
o
90.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden
Tho. Bodley
